intro: Euphrasia septentrionalis, commonly known as northern eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent, spurred petals that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia septentrionalis is part of the Scrophulariaceae family and is often found in regions with cool, temperate climates.
